content.text:
# Draft:1977 United Kingdom budget

The 1977 United Kingdom Budget was presented by Denis Healey, the Chancellor of the Exchequer, to the House of Commons on 19 March 1977. It was the fifth budget to be released by Healey. It was presented during high inflation, slow growth and industrial unrest, and it sought to balance economic recovery and restore confidence in the Pound sterling following the 1976 sterling crisis and the IMF Loan.
